question.title: Spring Boot: 400 Bad Request when sending JSON to POST endpoint (request body always null)
question.body:
I’m building a Spring Boot REST API and I’m stuck on an issue that I can’t figure out.

I have a simple POST endpoint that should receive a JSON payload and map it to a DTO, but every time I call the endpoint the request body is null. The controller is called successfully, but the DTO fields are all null, and sometimes I get a 400 Bad Request.

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/products")
public class ProductController {

    @PostMapping
    public ResponseEntity<String> createProduct(@RequestBody ProductRequest productRequest) {
        System.out.println("DEBUG => " + productRequest);
        return ResponseEntity.ok("Received");
    }
}


@Data
public class ProductRequest {
    private String name;
    private Double price;
}

Why is the @RequestBody not binding the JSON to my DTO? What could cause the request body to always be null in Spring Boot even with valid JSON?

answers.body:
With the given code , it will work fine if you use the import lombok.Data; in ProductRequest.
The possibility of 400 Bad Request is may be of your input type mismatch.

  • Ensure the field name and types match with Json (price is double, are you giving double value? Look the stack trace)

sample json request body

{
    "name": "Laptop",
    "price": 999.99
}
  • Also ensure @Data is from Lombok

Still getting the error please share your log details

question_comments.body: Can you please confirm if the annotation @Data comes from the Lombok framework? If yes: can you also provide the configuration that you used to install Lombok in your project?
Give the curl or the body you're sending.

(1) command: curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/api/products -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"name": "Laptop", "price": 999.99}' (2) output: DEBUG => ProductRequest(name=Laptop, price=999.99)
What are you sending, what does your DTO look like and how are you sending the body?
